Multidimensional Cube (OLAP)
Multidimensional cube or OLAP (Online Analytical Processing) is a powerful tool for efficient processing and analysis of a large amount of data in a convenient structured form.
The method got its name due to the fact that the obtained data is structured in the form of multidimensional cubes. Each face of the cube represents a dimension that allows the user to explore the data in the context of selected parameters.
Creating a Cube
To create or configure the new version of a multidimensional cube, go to the main menu items: Multivariative analysis → Cube.
On the page that opens, click
to create a new instance in which the following parameters are set:
Setting
Purpose
Cube settings
Name
The name of the multidimensional cube object to be created.
Data source
Selecting/adding the
source
whose data will be used for analysis.
The previously created data source is selected from the drop-down list, and the creation of a new data source is available in the parameter action menu.
In the
SaaS solution
, the number of rows returned by the data source cannot exceed 10000.
When deploying the platform in the
On-Premise
model, the data volume returned by the source is defined in the
configuration file
.
Further configuration is carried out on four tabs:
Dimenions
;
Facts
;
Parameters
;
OLAP Views
.
Dimensions tab
On this tab, dimensions are created and configured – these are the aspects by which data can be analyzed.
A dimension can be thought of as a time period, location, product groups, customers, various products, etc.
Two tables are used for this purpose:
The left "Dimensions" table is used to create measurements;
The right "Source –
source name
" table contains the generated source fields that can be used to configure the connection with measurements.
The list of possible cube dimensions is formed using the buttons above the left table:
Setting
Purpose
Creating a new dimension.
See more
under this table
.
Selecting a previously created dimension..
After clicking the button, a modal window opens, the dimension is selected from the drop-down list.
Viewing the registry of previously created dimensions is available by selecting the main menu items: Multivariative analysis → Cube dimensions.
Editing the settings of the selected dimension.
Deleting the selected dimension.
Viewing the registry data of the type specified in the dimension settings.
After clicking the button, the type registry will be opened in a modal window.
The button is available when selecting the dimension of the type "Dimension: object type".
When creating a new dimension, a modal window opens to select the dimension type, each type has its own settings:
"Dimension: source" – used to analyze data in the context of attributes obtained from another source.
"Dimension: object type" – used to analyze data in the context of attributes of the object type.
The settings for the "Dimension: object type" and "Dimension: source" types are similar and include:
Setting
Purpose
Name
Name of the dimension.
Object type
Selecting object types where attributes are to be analyzed for the data obtained from the data source.
The previously created object type is selected from the drop-down list, the creation of a new object type is available in the actions menu of the setting.
This setting is available when selecting "Dimension: object type".
Source
Selecting the
data source
, where it is necessary to analyze the data obtained from the data source added in the cube settings.
The previously created data source is selected from the drop-down list, the creation of a new data source is available in the actions menu of the setting.
This setting is available when selecting "Dimension: source".
Tabs
Attributes
On this tab, the dimension attributes are created.
When adding an attribute, specify:
Attribute name;
Attribute role:
Key – the key by which, through the dimension attribute, the relationship between the attribute of the object type/source field and the source field added in the cube settings will be configured;
Name – the name of the dimension attribute;
Additional information – the additional attribute that can later be used as a sorting field or parent attribute of the hierarchy.
Only one attribute with the "Name" role can be created.
Field links
On this tab, the user configures links between:
Dimension attributes and object type attributes – when setting up the dimension of the "Dimension: object type" type;
Dimension attributes and source fields – when setting up the dimension of the "Dimension: source" type .
Learn more about setting up the connection.
To create a link, select the dimension attribute in the left table and the object type attribute/source field in the right table, then click
.
The created relationship will be displayed next to the source field in the right table.
Each table element can be linked to another element only once.
Sortings
This tab allows sorting data by dimension attributes in a future cube visual.
The sorting is created using the
button, followed by selecting the dimension attribute and indicating the sorting direction:
In ascending order;
In descending order.
By default, the added sorting direction is set to "In ascending order".
Hierarchy
This tab allows displaying data in the cube visual as a hierarchy.
Use hierarchy
The switch that controls the ability to configure the hierarchy.
By default, the parameter is inactive.
Hierarchy attribute
Selecting an attribute containing the Object ID.
This parameter is available when the "Use hierarchy" switch is active.
Hierarchy attribute parent
Selecting an attribute that references the parent attribute.
This parameter is available when the "Use hierarchy" switch is active.
Parameters
This tab allows creating measurement parameters that are linked with the parameters of the data source (the process of creating links is described
previously
).
The tab is displayed when the "Cube dimension: source" type is selected.
"Dimension: calendar" – used to analyze data in the context of dates and is configured using the settings:
Setting
Purpose
Name
The name of the dimension.
Dynamics
Selecting the dimension dynamics type. The selection is made from the drop-down list:
Year;
Year-quarter;
Year-month;
Year-quarter-month;
Year-quarter-month-day;
Year-month-day.
The default dynamic type is "Year".
Lower border
Minimum periods until the current date
Entering the number of minimum periods up to the current date.
The default value is 5.
The parameter is available when the "Set algorithm" switch is inactive.
Set algorithm
The switch that defines how to determine the number of minimum periods before the current date:
when the switch is inactive, by entering a numeric value in the "Minimum periods until the current date" field.
when the switch is active, using the algorithm.
By default, the parameter is inactive.
Algorithm
Defining an algorithm that returns the number of minimum periods up to the current date.
The previously created algorithm is selected from the drop-down list, and the creation of a new algorithm is available through the setting’s action menu.
The parameter is available when the "Set by algorithm" switch is active.
Upper border
Minimum periods after the current date
Enter the number of minimum periods after the current date.
The default value is 5.
The parameter is available when the "Set algorithm" switch is inactive.
Set algorithm
The switch that defines how to determine the number of minor periods after the current date:
when the switch is inactive, by entering a numeric value in the "Minimum periods after the current date" field.
when the switch is active, using the algorithm.
By default, the parameter is inactive.
Algorithm
Defining an algorithm that returns the number of minimum periods after the current date.
The previously created algorithm is selected from the drop-down list, and the creation of a new algorithm is available through the setting’s action menu.
The parameter is available when the "Set algorithm" switch is active.
Result
Selecting the date on which the cube view should be displayed:
Start date of the period
Start date of the next period (as of the date)
By default, the value "Start date of the period" is selected as the result.
The link must be set up between the created dimension attributes and the source fields (the creation process is described
previously
).
Facts tab
This tab is designed to determine the quantitative indicators by which data will be aggregated for analysis.  For example, the number of orders, the volume or the amount of sales.
Currently, there is only one way to aggregate data – the amount.
Two tables are used for this purpose:
The left "Facts" table is used to create facts;
The right table "Source -
Name of the source
" contains generated source fields that can be used to set up relations with dimensions.
To create a fact, click
, place the cursor in the added field of the "Facts" table and enter the name of the fact.
Next, to create the link, select the fact in the left table, the source field in the right table and then click
.
Parameters tab
This tab is designed to add parameters which filter data for the cube visual.
It uses two tables:
The left "Dimension parameters" table is used to create parameters that will be added to the cube visual;
The right "Parameters" table contains the parameters of the data sources used. These parameters are divided into two groups:
"Source" – parameters of a data source that provides data for analyzing a multidimensional cube.
"Dimension" – previously added
"Source" cube type dimension
parameters.
To create a parameter, click
and fill in the necessary parameters in the modal window that opens:
A connection must be set up between the created parameters and the parameters of the data sources (the process of creating a connection is described
previously
).
OLAP Views tab
This tab is used to directly create visuals of a multidimensional cube for structuring, analyzing, and visualizing data.
The construction is based on the data source selected in the cube settings and the previously set parameters in
"Dimensions"
,
"Facts"
and
"Parameters"
tabs.
To create a new view, simply click the
button. The created object will then automatically open in a new browser tab.
The object name is set in the input field located in the control panel. In addition to standard buttons, the control panel also includes:
button for configuring OLAP cells and columns;
Learn more.
Clicking the button opens a modal window with the following set of parameters:
Setting
Purpose
Type of column width setting
Determining the column width. Possible options:
Match column widths to content – the width of the columns is adjusted depending on the content, but within the specified boundaries of the minimum and maximum width;
Same width of all columns – a fixed width is set for all columns.
Minimum column width (px)
Entering a numeric value to set the minimum allowed column width.
The parameter value must be greater than or equal to 20 px.
By default, the value is set to 20 px.
The parameter is displayed when selecting the column width "_Match column widths to content"
setting.
Maximum column width (px)
Entering a numeric value to set the maximum allowed column width.
The parameter value must be greater than or equal to the minimum column width.
By default, the value is set to 600 px.
The parameter is displayed when selecting the column width "_Match column widths to content"
setting.
Column width (px)
The parameter value must be greater than or equal to 100 px.
By default, the value is set to 200 px.
The parameter is displayed when you select the column width "Same width of all columns"
setting.
Hide empty cells (rows)
Indicates whether rows with missing contents are hidden in the cells.
Hide empty cells (columns)
Indicates whether to hide columns with missing content in their cells.
Show fact names
The feature that regulates the display of cells with the fact names in the OLAP visual.
button for saving the OLAP view;
Learn more.
The export button is displayed in the control panel only after the OLAP view has been rendered in the main workspace.
Clicking the
button downloads an *.xlsx format file to the local device with the name <Cube name>.<View name>.
button for opening cube settings in a new tab;
toggle for hiding the header and sidebar of the OLAP view in the page workspace.
View settings
The main part of the page is devoted to building an OLAP visual based on facts and dimensions moved to the interface of the header and sidebar of the OLAP visual.
The view is configured using:
selecting the required fact and dimension values for the report form from dropdown lists.
All available fact and dimension values are selected by default.
dragging and dropping (Drag&Drop) facts and dimensions from the "Fixed dimensions" block into the header and sidebar interface of the OLAP view;
Dragging and dropping is performed by holding down the
icon.
filtering data by selecting parameter values.
The order in which facts and dimensions are placed in the header and sidebar area of the OLAP view affects data display and grouping. Different arrangement combinations of facts and dimensions allow for effectively structuring information for analysis and informed decision-making.
Data visualization in the table is built according to the hierarchy of the selected fact and dimension values chosen from the dropdown lists.
Time series labels correspond to the dynamics selected in the
cube settings
.
Additionally, data formatting takes into account the interface language set in the browser.
Learn more about data formatting.
Data Type
Comment
Example
Number
Data is right-aligned with digit grouping.
The separator between integer and decimal parts depends on the interface language set in the browser.
10,000.54
Date and time
Data is left-aligned.
The separator and format depend on the interface language set in the browser.
01/10/2025 12:00 PM
Date
Data is left-aligned.
The separator and format depend on the interface language set in the browser.
01/10/2025
Time
Data is left-aligned.
The format depends on the interface language set in the browser.
12:00 PM
Text
Data is left-aligned.
Hello!
Boolean
Data is left-aligned.
The value is displayed as text according to the interface language set in the browser.
Yes
For a compact and focused view of the data, the dashboard can be minimized by clicking on the
icon, and the header and sidebar of the OLAP view can be minimized via the “Hide sidebar and header” switch.
The custom OLAP visual can be embedded into the dashboard via the
OLAP dashboard
.
